column1: banben:1banben:user:HelgeStenstrom user:Steve Jobs, co-founder of [[Apple]], was smart enough to realize what he saw at the [[Xerox]] [[Parc]] Demonstration of the [[GUI]] and [[mouse]], thus causing Apple Corporation to unleash the [[Macintosh]]
banben:3banben:user:Rp user:Steven, as he is called formally, has several (2?) children with her.
banben:2banben:user:HelgeStenstrom user:Born on February 24, 1955. Steve Paulis adopted soon after birth by Paul and Clara Jobs of Mountain View.

banben:2banben:user:HelgeStenstrom user:After graduating from Homestead High School in MountainView, Jobs enrolls in Reed College in Portland, Oregan where he drops out after one semester. In autumn of 1974, Jobs returned to California and began attending meetings of Wozniak's "Homebrew Computer Club." He takes a job at Atari Inc., designing computer games with his friend, [[Stephen Wozniak]]. In 1976 Jobs, then 21, and Wozniak, 26, found Apple Computer Co. in the Jobs' family garage. Jobs and Wozniak put together their first computer, called the Apple I. They marketed it in 1976 at a price of $666.

banben:2banben:user:HelgeStenstrom user:In 1983, Jobs lured John Scully from Pepsi-Cola to run Apple. In 1985, he was stripped of his duties by Scully. He forms NeXT with backing from Ross Perot, IBM, and Canon.
banben:2banben:user:HelgeStenstrom user:In 1986 Jobs buys a majority stake in Pixar, a San Rafael studio spun off from LucasFilm.
banben:2banben:user:HelgeStenstrom user:In 1991 Jobs married Laurene Powell.
banben:2banben:user:HelgeStenstrom user:In ____ he returned to Apple as CEO.
banben:2banben:user:HelgeStenstrom user:Described as an enfant terrible and mean-spirited, many have found him difficult to work with.
banben:2banben:user:HelgeStenstrom user:* [http://kzoo.edu/~k97as05/pfolio/jobs.html Steve Paul Jobs] a man who made computers friendly for everybody
